title: Cutting Through the Noise: Boosting Brand Positioning in Crowded Markets
description: Discover the power of unique brand positioning through Liquid Death‘s journey to dominate a saturated market by resonating with a specific crowd.
content: Have you ever felt like your product is just another face in the crowd? You're certainly not alone. In a saturated market, standing out is more challenging than ever. If your product blends into a sea of imitations and your marketing strategies are as thrilling as watching paint dry, your sales figures likely reflect that.But here's the thing: the key to brand recognition isn't about being the loudest in the room or the biggest spender. It's about positioning your brand differently. By connecting deeply with your audience and understanding their needs and desires, you can anticipate their wants before they do.To bring this to life, let’s explore the brand positioning journey of Liquid Death, the bold water brand that shook up the previously boring bottled water industry. By creating a unique image in the market and forging strategic brand partnerships, Liquid Death resonates powerfully with a specific audience. This profound understanding of their target market has propelled them to the industry spotlight.Ready to rock? Let’s dive in.Getting Noticed: It’s All About Knowing Your CrowdUnderstanding your audience may sound like basic marketing, but the true magic unfolds when you apply unique insights that delve deep into customer preferences and behaviors.In saturated markets like bottled water, merely knowing your audience is just the starting point. You must also leverage these insights to sculpt a memorable brand persona and develop strategic brand partnershipsLiquid Death didn't aim for a broad audience. Brands like Evian, Aquafina, and Fiji have already done that.Instead, they targeted specific lifestyles and subcultures. This focused approach enabled them to craft a distinct brand identity, boldly encapsulated in their tagline, "Murder Your Thirst." This phrase captures attention and resonates with their niche yet vibrant market segment while cleverly declaring a ‘death to plastic’ environmental incentive–a mission for their loyal followers to rally behind.By crafting a brand that aligns deeply with its audience’s values, Liquid Death’s strategy goes beyond merely meeting basic needs. It taps into a cultural resonance that ignites intense customer loyalty and enthusiasm, effectively elevating the brand in its market.Liquid Death: How Water Became Metal Liquid Death has distinguished itself in the highly competitive bottled water industry by selling not just water but a brand experience aligned with a unique audience. Unlike typical food and drink brands like Evian, which share audience overlaps with giants like Coke and Starbucks, Liquid Death's following is starkly distinct, echoing its bold, edgy brand persona.Their tribe encompasses moshpit-loving, tattoo-sporting, environmentally-conscious outlaws who prefer a rebellious twist to the traditional bottled water experience.But how exactly did they achieve this distinct positioning?Using the Audience Intelligence app, let’s examine who makes up the Liquid Death audience and what sets them apart. TipYou can explore this app for free and analyze four demo reports without paying for a subscription.Decoding Audience Insights Using Audience IntelligenceAudience Intelligence, an app developed by Audiense, offers in-depth consumer segmentation and cultural insights from social data. We only needed Liquid Death's X (Twitter) handle to get all the details regarding its audience. Once inputted, the app returned precise insights about the brand's followers, clearly showing who engages with their content and why.Here’s what we saw:Audience Intelligence’s “Clusters” illustrate that Liquid Death’s primary audience consists of non-conformist young men (25-34) who revel in movies, pop culture, gaming, and tech. The app confirms this group is markedly different from your average beverage consumer and is deeply engaged with several niche interests: Crypto and NFTs: The audience shows a significant interest in cryptocurrencies and NFTs, reflecting their affinity for tech and cutting-edge trends. Dark Comedies and Cartoons: Comedians like Patton Oswalt and Sarah Silverman are popular among this group, showcasing their taste for satirical and witty humor. Horror: They like the horror genre, further emphasizing their unique tastes. Sports and Gaming: Sports and gaming are central hobbies for this audience, and they are avid followers of accounts that exhibit witty humor.Each insight reaffirms that Liquid Death’s audience is unique in its tastes and deeply engaged with content that resonates with its distinct lifestyle and preferences, making it a perfect match for the brand’s edgy and unconventional approach.Amplifying Your Brand Positioning with PartnershipsPartnerships are key to amplifying your brand’s visibility and resonating with the right crowd. By teaming up with other brands, personalities, or media that vibe with your audience’s interests and values, you can boost your brand's appeal. The Audience Intelligence app is a game-changer here. It reveals potential partnerships by highlighting how closely your audience aligns with other groups or segments in the Influencers and Brands tab.Some of the partnerships the app suggested for Liquid Death have become real deals, showing how spot-on this tool can be. It checks out where the interests and behaviors of different audiences overlap, giving you a solid idea of where your brand could really connect and make an impact.Top Matches for Liquid Death Given their interests, several partnerships stand out as particularly relevant for Liquid Death. By looking at both Affinity and Uniqueness, we can identify how well a partner brand’s audience aligns with the Liquid Death audience. Uniqueness: How relevant a brand or person is to your audience compared to the baseline chosen (in the images below, the baseline is the US - General audience). Affinity: The percentage of an audience that follows another specific brand or influencer (anything over 6% can be considered high affinity). Here’s how Liquid Death’s recent partnerships align with their audience: Ozzy Osbourne: Among the partnerships that have proven particularly relevant for Liquid Death, Ozzy Osbourne stands out. A commercial featuring Ozzy Osbourne illustrates this alignment.Data from the Audience Intelligence app confirms his strong resonance with Liquid Death’s image, with nearly 8% of the 148,723-person audience showing affinity Fortnite:Fortnite, with its massive appeal in the gaming community, is another standout partnership for Liquid Death, aligning with 8% of their full audience. This collaboration tapped into the gaming cluster, leveraging Fortnite's immersive events and exclusive in-game items to resonate deeply with Liquid Death's target demographic, improving engagement and reinforcing their edgy brand identity. Travis Barker: Travis Barker, known for his status in the rock and punk scenes, aligns well with approximately 5% of Liquid Death’s audience who admire his music and lifestyle. This partnership leveraged Travis's influence to craft a unique limited edition product that could get the attention of both the artist and the brand, amplifying Liquid Death's presence in the music and lifestyle space. The Boys: Although only 4% of Liquid Death’s audience currently follows The Boys, this partnership is still valuable, given that the general benchmark interest is around 0.13%. The show's dark, rebellious humor and critique of corporate culture mesh well with Liquid Death’s brand ethos. A collaborative effort includes a commercial with The Boys that promotes the premiere of a new season. This taps into the show's cult following to broaden Liquid Death’s reach and enhance engagement, effectively connecting the brand with its audience. By analyzing audience data, the app pinpoints which partnerships will likely be most effective by assessing the overlap in audience interests and behaviors. It also highlights many potential collaborations by illustrating the affinity between different segments or groups.Spotlight on Liquid Death's NFT & Crypto Audience Cluster Each "cluster" is like a mini-fandom within your larger audience.To drill down into any Cluster or community, click the “View more details” arrow at the bottom of the tile.For example, take a look at NFT & Crypto Cluster. When you click on more details, you can review nine categories in the menu at the top of the page. Under the Demographics tab, you see that the audience is predominantly male, with many residing in major US cities like Los Angeles, Miami, Chicago, and New York City. As their interests suggest, they are deeply involved in cryptocurrencies and NFTs, showcasing a strong inclination towards technology and cutting-edge trends. Under the Influencers & Brands tab, it’s evident that they follow profiles aligning with these categories, like Coinbase and Ledger. The personality analysis reveals that they are an expressive, active, and particular group. They are open to new ideas, inclined to challenge authority for positive change, and are trusting of others.The Media Affinity analysis shows that they engage with content like Ted Talks, Coachella, the Burning Man Project, and Tomorrowland, indicating that they appreciate cultural experiences, creative expression, and vibrant community events.By continually harnessing these insights, Liquid Death can maintain and enhance its connection with its audience, ensuring its marketing efforts remain relevant and impactful.This approach is vital for any brand looking to stand out—let's explore how you can apply similar tactics to make your own brand pop.Breaking the Mold: How to Position Your BrandTo carve your niche in a crowded market, you need a plan that's as sharp as it is strategic. Consider these steps to capture your audience's attention and keep them engaged and loyal.1. Dig Deep into DataBasic demographic data is a good place to start, but relying too heavily on surface level demographics often leads to broad, ineffective marketing strategies. Instead, dive deeper into data using advanced analytics tools like Audience Intelligence. This way, you can uncover hidden patterns and trends, such as preferences for eco-friendly products or greater engagement with video content. This detailed information allows you to tailor your marketing efforts, transform your approach from broad to targeted, and ensure your brand gets noticed and truly resonates.2. Find Your Unique AngleDoes it feel like everything has been done before? That’s your cue to mix things up, and you can use audience insight to unearth unique intersections of interests. Consider Liquid Death's audience, characterized by a strong passion for environmentalism and an affinity for heavy metal music. This unique mix presented a golden opportunity to carve out a distinctive niche in a market usually dominated by more traditional brands like Evian and Fiji Water.By embracing this bold blend, Liquid Death introduced environmentally conscious products with a heavy metal aesthetic, distinguishing themselves dramatically from the typical, more subdued water brands and directly appealing to a uniquely engaged audience segment.Embracing these distinctive audience intersections allows your brand to offer something new and exciting, distinguishing you from competitors and capturing the attention of a specific, engaged audience segment. By leveraging unique aspects of your audience's identity, you create a brand experience that feels personal and directly tailored to their interests, setting your brand apart in a memorable and impactful way.3. Craft a Distinct Brand PersonaTo avoid blending in, shape a brand persona that’s as distinctive as it is compelling. Drawing on detailed insights from your audience data can guide the development of a persona that genuinely stands out.For example, if your data reveals that your audience is passionate about sustainability and has a quirky sense of humor, consider positioning your brand with a cheeky but green character. This persona could blend environmental activism with a light-hearted, humorous approach, making your brand relatable and memorable.Incorporating these traits consistently across all your marketing materials—from social media posts to influencer partnerships and customer service interactions will ensure that every touchpoint with customers reinforces this unique persona. This strategic alignment makes your brand visible but also beloved and unforgettable. This approach will help your brand cut through the noise, fostering a solid emotional connection with your audience that elevates your brand beyond the ordinary.4. Speak Your Audience's LanguageEffective communication hinges on your ability to speak in a way that resonates authentically with your audience. Abandon the generic, one-size-fits-all approach and embrace the unique linguistic quirks of your target demographic.If your audience favors casual language or the latest internet memes, incorporate these elements into your communication strategy. This could mean tweeting with popular slang, using emojis, avoiding technical terms in your blog posts, or creating content that reflects the humor and interests specific to your niche.By adapting your brand’s voice to mirror your audience's, your messages will strike a chord, fostering a sense of familiarity and trust. This approach doesn’t just engage—it connects on a deeper level, turning casual followers into loyal fans.5. Be Where Your Audience IsTo reach your audience, you need more than a broadcast approach. Instead, pinpoint where your audience is most active—both online and offline. This could include platforms like Instagram, X, Reddit, and TikTok, or in person occasions like concerts and sporting events.Once you know where they spend time, tailor your marketing strategies to these platforms. By meeting them on their own turf, you create opportunities for deeper interaction and engagement, which can lead to higher conversion rates and stronger brand loyalty.However, make sure your content is present and optimized for each platform's unique format and audience preferences. This targeted approach ensures that your marketing efforts are efficient, relevant, and more likely to resonate with your intended demographic.6. Continuously Evolve with Your AudienceAudience preferences are constantly evolving, and what’s trendy one month might be outdated the next. Keep your strategies agile by continuously monitoring shifts in interests. Regularly updating and tweaking your approach based on fresh data will help you stay relevant and maintain a strong bond with your audience.By deepening your understanding of who your audience is and continually adapting your strategies to meet their evolving needs, you can ensure your brand not only stands out but thrives in a competitive environment. Remember, making waves isn’t just about what you do differently; it’s about how well you connect and stay relevant to your audience over time.Next Steps for Brand SuccessReady to elevate your brand recognition and cultivate meaningful brand partnerships? Start by diving deep into your audience's world and exploring the intersections that define them. Tap into these insights to build a brand that stands out and truly resonates.Use tools like the Audience Intelligence app to uncover the rich, detailed insights needed to drive these efforts.
